    <div id="commentslistp4047073" style="display:none; margin:0px 10px;">

    <div id="content">
     <div id="contentleft" style="width:230px;">
      <div id="leftboxes">
       <div id="wrapbox14692762">
        <div class="roundbox outerbox" id="14692762">
         <div class="roundbox headerbox" id="title14692762">
          <div class="bi_text">
           &nbsp;
          </div>
          <h2>
           What is Scholarly?
          </h2>
         </div>
         <div class="roundbox innerbox innerbox_1" id="content14692762">
          <p>
           <strong>
            On this page:
           </strong>
          </p>
          <ul>
           <li>
            <a href="http://libraryguides.muhlenberg.edu/content.php?pid=471100&amp;sid=4047073#14692740">
             What is a Scholarly Source?
            </a>
           </li>
           <li>
            <a href="http://libraryguides.muhlenberg.edu/content.php?pid=471100&amp;sid=4047073#14692744">
             What is Peer Review?
            </a>
           </li>
           <li>
            <a href="http://libraryguides.muhlenberg.edu/content.php?pid=471100&amp;sid=4047073#14692749">
             Why Use Scholarly Sources?
            </a>
           </li>
           <li>
            <a href="http://libraryguides.muhlenberg.edu/content.php?pid=471100&amp;sid=4047073#14692754">
             Finding Scholarly Sources
            </a>
           </li>
          </ul>
          <div id="boxatt14692762" class="boxatt">
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </div>
     <div id="contentcenter" style="width:520px;padding-left:0px; margin-left:0px; margin-right:8px; float:left;">
      <div id="centerboxes">
       <div id="wrapbox14692740">
        <div class="roundbox outerbox" id="14692740">
         <div class="roundbox headerbox" id="title14692740">
          <div class="bi_text">
           &nbsp;
          </div>
          <h2>
           What is a Scholarly Source?
          </h2>
         </div>
         <div class="roundbox innerbox innerbox_1" id="content14692740">
          <p>
           The following characteristics can identify a source as scholarly:
          </p>
          <ul>
           <li>
            AUTHOR
            <br />
            The author of the source is a scholar or expert in the field discussed, not just a journalist or "staff writer."
            <br />
            <br />
           </li>
           <li>
            CITED SOURCES
            <br />
            The source provides substantial citations, such as footnotes or a bibliography.
            <br />
            <br />
           </li>
           <li>
            CONTENT &amp; PURPOSE
            <br />
            The source discusses a narrowly defined topic and may review existing literature concerning the topic, present new research based on experiments or archival work, or interpret a well-researched idea in a new way.
            <br />
            <br />
           </li>
           <li>
            LANGUAGE &amp; AUDIENCE
            <br />
            The article uses technical language specific to the discipline, often requiring the reader to have scholarly background in the area.&nbsp; The source is intended for scholars, researchers, and students, rather than the general public.
            <br />
            <br />
           </li>
           <li>
            PEER-REVIEW
            <br />
            The source is reviewed and edited by other experts in the discipline.
           </li>
          </ul>
          <div id="boxatt14692740" class="boxatt">
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div id="wrapbox14692744">
        <div class="roundbox outerbox" id="14692744">
         <div class="roundbox headerbox" id="title14692744">
          <div class="bi_text">
           &nbsp;
          </div>
          <h2>
           What is Peer Review?
          </h2>
         </div>
         <div class="roundbox innerbox innerbox_1" id="content14692744">
          <p>
           Peer review is a process through which some scholarly articles and book chapters are critically evaluated by experts with in-depth knowledge of the research area before publication in order to ensure the information is valid, credible, well-written, and of high quality
           <span>
            .
           </span>
          </p>
          <p>
           <span>
            Are you looking especially for peer-reviewed journal articles?&nbsp; See
            <a href="http://libraryguides.muhlenberg.edu/content.php?pid=471100&amp;sid=3874364#14024403">
             Verifying Peer Review
            </a>
            .&nbsp;
            <br />
           </span>
          </p>
          <div id="boxatt14692744" class="boxatt">
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div id="wrapbox14692749">
        <div class="roundbox outerbox" id="14692749">
         <div class="roundbox headerbox" id="title14692749">
          <div class="bi_text">
           &nbsp;
          </div>
          <h2>
           Why Use Scholarly Sources?
          </h2>
         </div>
         <div class="roundbox innerbox innerbox_1" id="content14692749">
          <p>
           Because scholarly sources are well-researched, written by experts, and discuss topics in great depth and detail, they have credibility and authority.&nbsp; Using scholarly sources in your own research gives your work credibility and authority, as well.&nbsp; Non-scholarly materials can also be useful and appropriate for some academic purposes, but generally scholarly sources are expected in academic research.&nbsp;
          </p>
          <div id="boxatt14692749" class="boxatt">
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div id="wrapbox14692754">
        <div class="roundbox outerbox" id="14692754">
         <div class="roundbox headerbox" id="title14692754">
          <div class="bi_text">
           &nbsp;
          </div>
          <h2>
           Finding Scholarly Sources
          </h2>
         </div>
         <div class="roundbox innerbox innerbox_1" id="content14692754">
          <p>
           Other sections in these Get Started with Library Research guides discuss how to find scholarly sources.&nbsp; See the
           <a href="http://libraryguides.muhlenberg.edu/content.php?pid=471100&amp;sid=3856384">
            Find Information
           </a>
           section, especially the
           <a href="http://libraryguides.muhlenberg.edu/content.php?pid=471100&amp;sid=3874364#14024403">
            Find Articles
           </a>
           and
           <a href="http://libraryguides.muhlenberg.edu/content.php?pid=471100&amp;sid=3874366">
            Find Books
           </a>
           pages.&nbsp; The
           <a href="http://libraryguides.muhlenberg.edu/">
            Subject Guides
           </a>
           may help, too.&nbsp; They point you toward recommended resources in each subject area, through which you can find scholarly sources.&nbsp;
          </p>
          <p>
           Need more help with this?
           <a href="http://trexler.muhlenberg.edu/research/ask-a-librarian.html">
            Ask a Librarian
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <div id="boxatt14692754" class="boxatt">
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </div>
     <div id="contentright" style="width:209px;float:left; padding-right:0px;">
      <div id="profile4047073" class="profile_wrapper">
      </div>
      <div id="rightboxes">
       <div id="wrapbox14692432">
        <div class="roundbox outerbox" id="14692432">
         <div class="roundbox headerbox" id="title14692432">
          <div class="bi_text">
           &nbsp;
          </div>
          <h2>
           Get Help
          </h2>
         </div>
         <div class="roundbox innerbox innerbox_1" id="content13943779">
          <p>
           Need more help with this?&nbsp;
           <a href="http://trexler.muhlenberg.edu/research/ask-a-librarian.html">
            Ask a Librarian
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <p>
           <br />
           Need help with writing?&nbsp; Contact the
           <a href="http://www.muhlenberg.edu/main/academics/writing/center/">
            Writing Center
           </a>
           .
          </p>
          <div id="boxatt13943779" class="boxatt">
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>
     </div>
    </div>

       </tr>
      </table>
      <div id="popupinfotitle" style="display:inline;">
       <h6>
        More Information
       </h6>
      </div>
     </div>
     <div class="popup_body">
      <div id="popupinfocontent" style="display:inline;">
       <img alt="Loading" src="http://lgimages.s3.amazonaws.com/indicator.gif" />
       &nbsp; Loading...
      </div>
      <br />
      <center>
       <a href="#" onclick="hideAlert('popupinfo'); return false;">
        Close
       </a>
      </center>
     </div>
    </div>
   </div>
  </div>
  <div id="dp" style="width:850px;">
   &nbsp;
  </div>
  <script type="text/javascript">
   cssdropdown.startchrome("tabs12");
  </script>
  <script type="text/javascript">
   SpringTrack.trackPage({ 
                        st_type : content_config.hitsource, 
                        _st_gid : content_config.gid 
                    });
  </script>
 </body>
</html>
